text: True… i did post on this group earlier about this requirement actually and heard interesting views. from the candidate perspective, my suggestion was to incentivise by title hacker developer/ web product manager and the promise of working in true hybrid enterprise startup mode (the truths). The hidden reality is the technical work is pretty monotonous and there's no real career growth like handling a larger tech team or increased responsibilities etc. Industry standard is to outsource these kind of work to web designer services. Its cheap. The smarter chaps end up freelancing since industry doesnt pay them any higher. Sigh. I will try looking for another 2 months since my boss wants me to. If it doesn't work i guess i will ask her to get a project manager and continuing the outsourcing model.

text: Guys, any one looking to break into Product side of things?  Looking for someone who loves automations using Zapier or other no-code tools. Has a good understanding for CS technology (fundamentals).  DM me!
